runs.comm: lovely delivery to start off. From round the stumps, Taylor curved it in towards the off stump, defended to the off side
But he strays to the pad this time and Gambhir whips it off his hips to fine-leg boundary. The short fine-leg is in.
142.7 kmph sharp bouncer, coming at the face of Gambhir who hops to push it down to the off side. Taylor has a lovely slow bouncer as well.
139.6 kmph kicking up from back of length, tapped close on the off side, towards point and they rush across for the single

Taylor stays round the stumps to Rohit as well. Interesting. He slips in a slower one, that dips full on the middle stump line, Rohit lunges out to adjust to it and pushes it to wide mid-on where Chanders fields

just over second slip What a cracker of a bouncer. That almost took out Gambhir. Superb delivery. Gambhir hopped in alarm, taking the eyes of it and fended it in an ungainly manner but the ball popped just behind the leaping slip fielder.
Fidel serves a short-pitched delivery to his IPL team-mate and Rohit responds with a pull through midwicket. It was quite pacy delivery, 149.4 kmph, and Rohit did well to play the horizontal shot

Undaunted by the pulled four, Fidel simply cranks up another short-pitched delivery from back of length.. Rohit is beaten for the pace and by the extra bounce, top edges the pull to square leg. Great start from Windies. Taylor served up a fiery first over and now, Fidel has started in a similar vein.
short of length and outside off stump, left alone
146.5 kmph bouncer over the middle stump line, Gambhir ducks
pushed to the off side for a single
short of length outside off, tapped to point region
The slower bouncer now. He has a great control of it. Raina is made to wait and he waits before swatting it past square leg
Gambhir walks down the track and Taylor hurls a high bouncer that sails well above Gambhir
Again, he walks down the wicket, Taylor keeps it fuller this time but drifts towards the pad, rolls away to short fine-leg and Ramdin rushes after it and stops with a dive
slower one, full in length this time and Raina leans forward to chip it high over mid-off
short and wide this time, not a great delivery that, and Gambhir slaps it over point. Indians on the counterattack here.
walks down and towards off stump and turns the length delivery towards midwicket for a single
shapes to off drive on the up but mistimes it and edges it away to the on side
short in length, outside off, tapped to third man
150.6 kmph sharp bouncer on the middle stump, Raina ducks. Raina has had problems in the past against the bouncer. Let's see how he goes today.
length delivery on the off stump line, opens the bat-face and guides it to point
151.1 kmph bouncer and there we go. Raina is in trouble. He looks uncomfortable as he swats it away limply to square leg
fuller but just down the leg side and in T20, it's a wide

Full in length and slanting away from Raina, who after the bouncers, was hanging on the  back foot. He simply hung his bat out to dry and Ramdin says thank you as he dives neatly to his left to take it inches off the turf. Raina stood his ground, the umpires weren't sure whether it carried and they went upstairs. Replays confirm it went in cleanly. Gone! Ramdin almost knocked Gayle off in attempt to throw the ball up in the air, while celebrating.
on the middle and leg, from short of length, tucked to backward square leg
short in length moving away from Yuvraj who runs it down to third man

Three down now. What a delightful start by the Windies. It was the short-pitched delivery that did the trick. Gambhir top edged the pull and Lendl ran back from square leg and lunged forward in the end to take a very fine catch. First Ramdin and now Lendl; the West Indian fielders are doing a great job.
short in length, around the off and middle, Yuvraj leans forward to defend to the off side
full and swinging down the leg side. Ramdin appeals for a catch. Yuvraj is bemused that it has not been given a wide. The replays seem to suggest that the ball didn't hit bat or pad
another single, down to third man.
short in length, coming in towards middle stump, Dhoni leans forward to push it to the on side of the pitch
short in length, on the middle and leg, Yuvraj wrists it past square leg for couple of runs.
beaten outside off stump. Full in length and moving away from Yuvraj who flirts
banged in short and at the body, Yuvraj hops to tuck it down to square leg
moving towards the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg for a single
dug in short and Yuvraj miscues the pull shot but will pick up some runs as the ball rolls to deep midwicket region
backs away outside leg, Fidel goes for the stumps and Yuvraj crashes it past mid-off. It's all happening.
flighted around off and middle, Dhoni doesn't take the bait; pushes it down the track
tries to pinch a single with a tap to the on side but midwicket fielder rushes in quickly
And so, he uses the wrists more this time and turns the ball past square leg
floated full outside off, nudged to the off side

tossed up full around the off stump, Yuvraj goes for the sweep, topedges it and would have had his heart in his mouth as the ball hung in the air for a long time but eventually, fell clear of Sarwan running across from deep backward square leg
leans forward to push it to the on side
short and wide, forced off the backfoot but straight to sweeper cover
punched to extra cover for a single
slower one, curving away from Yuvraj who dabs it to third man
another slower one, Dhoni walks into the shot, is made to wait and he jabs it to cover
mediumpace on the off stump line, punched to cover.
around 121 kmph length delivery, again Dhoni is early into his punchy drive and the ball rolls to the off side
stays back to punch a skidding delivery to right of long-on. Dhoni wanted the second, Yuvraj says no
Again, confusion between the two batsmen. Dhoni pushed it towards cover and set off and had to rush to get back in
worked past square leg for a single
leans forward to drive to long-off for a single
on the off and middle line, pushed gently back to Gayle
again Dhoni sets for a non-existent run. It was pushed towards midwicket and Yuvraj sent him back quickly
leans back to chop it down to third man
length delivery outside off, Dhoni tries to punch on the up but is beaten and Ramdin, standing up to the stumps, collects.
short in length, cut away to deep cover
short in length, outside off stump, mistimes the pull shot towards long-on and the mistime gives them time to come back for the second run
full in length, angling away, Yuvraj tries to dab it to third man and is beaten
And again. Ramdin collects and rushes to congratulate the bowler. This one cut away from Yuvraj who couldn't put bat to ball.
walks into his shot which was a swat past square leg and he turns back for the second run
fires in a yorker length delivery, dug out but gets enough meat to get it past the bowler and it rolls towards long-off
floated full on the leg and middle, flicked away nicely but straight to deep backward square leg
charges down the track, Gayle slows up the pace and shortens the length, Dhoni lunges out to drive to long-off
quicker, outside off, full, driven to long-off
leans forward to defend to the off side of the pitch. Another tight over from West Indies. The strangle is on.
goes back to punch it to midwicket
turns it from outside off stump, Yuvraj reverse sweeps it past short third man. Good fielding near the ropes to pull the back in. By Chanderpaul.
top spinner just outside off, Dhoni backs away to cut but the ball skids and bounces over the flashing blade and Ramdin gathers
stretches forward to drive to long-off
slightly short and Yuvraj cuts to deep backward point
straighter one, skidding in off the length, Dhoni lunges to push it to cover point.

And Dhoni falls after a painful little knock. It was banged in short and outsdie off and Dhoni, actually played his best shot of the day. A shot full of intent. He rocked back to cut it hard and flat but couldn't clear the man stationed near the ropes at deep backward point. The captain is gone and Windies celebrate.
The sharp bouncer and Yusuf, who has also problems against the bouncers, fends it off somehow to the on side
Stop the press! it's the first boundary in seven overs! Short and wide, Yuvraj rocked back to cut it hard and to deep backward point boundary

Dropped by Fletcher at deep square leg region. Yuvraj flicked the full delivery in the air and Fletcher ran towards his left, appeared to have reached in time but threw in a dive instead of a lunge and the ball spilled out of his palms. He recovers to fire in a throw at the striker's end to try get a run out. Yusuf Pathan dives to get in the crease but seems to have injured his shoulder in the process. He is in tremendous pain. The physio is out there to treat the right shoulder.
tails in towards the hips and bounds away off the thigh pad to Ramdin
pushed to the on side for a single.
leans well forward to tap it to the on side
really full in length, pushed past midwicket, where Gayle lunges to his left but doesn't stop it.
pushed well outside off stump,
again outside off, turns in slightly, Yuvraj misses the cut shot
yorker length on the middle, dug out back to the bowler
really full up to Yuvraj who drives it hard but straight to the bowler
Top shot! His signature slog sweep. He went down on his knee to send the ball soaring into the midwicket stands.
from round the stumps, slower one outside off, Yusuf is early into the big drive and misses it completely
the short-pitched delivery again has Yusuf in trouble. Plus that angle from round the stumps as well. He took his eyes off the ball and jabbed it away to the point region
very skilful shot. It was drifting towards middle and leg, full, and Yuvraj used his wrists superbly to flick it in the air but well to the left of the deep square leg fielder.
moves outside leg, Bravo hurls across a yorker, dug out towards long-off

Yusuf adapts much better to the bouncer this time. Perhaps, he was expecting it. It was slanting away from him, he stayed adjacent to the line, opened his bat-face and guided it through the vacant slip region
Yusuf goes down town now. Big over for India. It was full and Yusuf lifted it high in the air and the long-on fielder tumbled over the boundary while trying to take it.
slightly short in length, pulled away to deep midwicket
on the middle, slower this time, tapped to cover
floated full and Yusuf drills it hard and well to the left of the long-on fielder. four more. The crowd roar.
slows up the pace, Yusuf waits before steering it to point region
quicker one, but on the leg and middle, Yuvraj tries to paddle it away and gets a top edge to fine-leg region
Shot! flighted full on the middle, Yuvraj cleared the front leg and scythed it to the cowcorner. Lovely swing of the bat. 50 up. What a fine innings this has been.
short in length and pulled away to deep square leg region
137.8 kmph full delivery outside off stump, Yuvraj partly edges it, partly steers it through vacant slip region. The runs are coming in a flood now.
The bouncer nearly does the trick again. Yuvraj top edges the pull but luckily, for him, it flies behind the keeper
fullish, outside off, Yuvraj tries to square drive but doesn't connect. Great buzz around the arena. The Indian fans are clearing thier throat. Singh is King, says one banner.
Fabulicious pull. He cleared the front leg and swat-pulled it superbly to the midwicket boundary.

Oh gorgeous pick-up flick to midwicket boundary. It's the shot that Dhoni used to play a lot, that twirl of the bottom-hand. Yuvraj added beauty to it now. Lovely bat swing and he whipped the full delivery to the boundary.
swing and a miss. 142.1 kmph length delivery outside off, Yusuf tries to lift it over the bowler but misses it completely.
the chest-high bouncer, Yusuf stabs it wide of third man where Chanders makes the stop
goes for the yorker but slips it down the leg side and Ramdin gets across in time to gather
bouncing into the rib-cage, Yusuf is cramped and jabs it away to square leg

Fidel terminates a superb innings from Yuvraj. Again, it was the short-pitched ball that did the trick. Yuvraj top-edges the pull and this time it lobs straight to the on side and Fidel positions himself under it. A very fine entertaining knock comes to an end.
The bouncer troubles Yusuf. Again. He hopped, eyes off the ball and stabbed it off the outer edge to gully

Another short-pitched delivery, head high at 90 mph, Irfan is late on the pull and the white ball flies to Ramdin. Irfan is a good player of the short-pitched bowling. So it should be interesting few overs.
from round the stumps, the slower bouncer but Yusuf has killed that one. He picked it early, waited and thrashed it to the wide midwicket boundary.
fuller, quicker, on the leg and middle though, flicked away to deep square leg region
dropped by Taylor. It kicked up from short of length, Yusuf mistimed the pull and Taylor jumped but ended up palming it.
Big swing and a miss. Yusuf moved outside leg, Taylor followed him with a full delivery, Yusuf tried to slog it across the line but couldn't connect
the chest hight bouncer, almost 140 kmph, Yusuf mistimes the pull and it falls well short of deep square leg
almost a yorker length delivery, dug out towards long-on and by the time Bravo runs in from the deep to mid-on, they collect two runs
Bravo cleans up Yusuf. 129.3 kmph yorker from round the stumps pegs back the off stump. Yusuf swung early, the bottom-hand coming off the handle in the end but no wood on leather. TImber!
slower one outside off, Harbhajan adjusts to punch it to deep point region
And in the middle, his brother holes out to deep midwicket. He planted his front leg outside the leg stump, hit the full delivery straight to the man.
Third man was in the circle and Bravo pushes it wide outside off from round the stumps. Harbhajan lunged out to slice it away past short third man
back over the stumps now, fullish delivery outside off stump and Harbhajan unfurls a very fine square drive. he hung on the back foot, opened the bat-face and wristed it past point
Three in a row. Harbhajan finishes the innings in style. He read the slower one early, went down on his knee and crashed it to the cowcorner.
